variant.question: During an approach with L/G not down locked, flaps extended and both engines not at T.O power you get master warning and ECAM 'gear not down!' at an radio height of

options.text: lower than 1,000 ft and higher than 850 ft.
lower than 850 ft and higher than 750 ft
lower than 750 ft

variant.question: System page 'wheel': With regard to the L/G position indicator triangles. The top row shows green triangles while in the second row no triangles are shown. Is the L/G down?

options.text: Yes
No

variant.question: The landing gear indicator panel receives the information from microswitches and proximity detectors connected to:

options.text: LGCIU 1
LGCIU 2
LGCIU 2 & BSCU 2
LGCIU 1 & BSCU 1

variant.question: The red arrow, near the landing gear lever illuminates when:

options.text: Landing gear is not down locked in landing configuration
Landing gear is not uplocked after retraction.
Landing gear is in abnormal position.

variant.question: The landing gear indicator panel unlock light illuminates red if:

options.text: Gear is not locked in selected position.
Gear is extended by gravity and doors are not closed.
Gear is extended normally and doors are not closed.

variant.question: If tire damage is suspected after landing or after a rejected takeoff, an inspection of the tires is required before taxi. If the tire is deflated but not damaged, the aircraft can be taxied at low speed with the following limitations :

options.text: f one tire is deflated on one or more gears (i.e. a maximum of three tires), the speed should be limited to 7 knots when turning.
If two tires are deflated on the same main gear (the other main gear tires not being deflated), speed should be limited to 3 knots and the nose wheel steering angle limited to 30 degrees.
Both answers are correct

variant.question: How many turns are necessary to extend the landing gear by gravity using the handcrank:

options.text: Ten turns clockwise.
Five turns clockwise
Three turns clockwise

variant.question: After lift off, is the brakes hot caution on ECAM still displayed?

options.text: Yes, with gear down or up.
Yes, with gear down only.
No, it is not displayed.

variant.question: On wheel page of ECAM, AUTO BRK is flashing green:

options.text: Auto brake is disengaged (flashing green for 10 seconds).
Auto brake failure
Anti-skid failure

variant.question: On the ramp with APU running, PARK BRK is set ON, message on ECAM shows PARK BRK.
After a landing gear gravity extension, is it possible to restore normal landing gear operation if green hydraulic pressure is available:

options.text: Yes
No

variant.question: The nose wheel steering is powered:

options.text: By hydraulic system.
By electric system.
By hydraulic and electric systems.

variant.question: Nose wheel steering by rudder pedals is limited to:

options.text: 2° to 6° under all circumstances.
0° to 6° depending on A/C speed.

variant.question: When handwheel and pedals are operated simultaneously

options.text: Handwheel has priority
Pedals have priority
Orders are algebraically added
As long as the handwheel is moved, the pedal inputs are inhibited

variant.question: At _______________ the connection between nosewheel steering and the rudder pedals is removed

options.text: 130 knots (aircraft ground speed)
110 knots (aircraft ground speed)
touchdow

variant.question: How many Landing Gear Control and Interface Units (LGCIUs) control the extension and retraction of the gear and the operation of the doors?

options.text: LGCIU 1 controls the operation of the gears, LGCIU 2 controls the operation of the doors
One LGCIU controls one complete gear cycle, then switches over automatically to the other LGCIU at the completion of the retraction cycle.
Three Units: One LGCIU controls the operation of each landing gear strut. LGCIU 3 additionally controls the operation of all doors.

variant.question: When both handwheels are operated simultaneously, the signals:

options.text: From the first pilot acting on his handwheel have priority
Coming from the captain have priority.
Are added algebraically.

variant.question: A safety valve automatically cuts off hydraulic supply to the landing gear system when flying faster than :

options.text: 280 kts
250 kts.
260 kts.

variant.question: After T/O the left main gear shock absorber is stuck in compressed position.

options.text: The gear can be retracted under all circumstances (safety).
The gear can be retracted provided the nose gear is centred.
The gear can not be retracted.

variant.question: .20 Is it possible (system wise) to lower the gear by gravity above 260 kts?

options.text: Yes
No

variant.question: 1 The anti-skid and nose wheel switch is set to off:

options.text: Anti-skid only is deactivated
Nose wheel steering only is deactivated.
Anti-skid and nose wheel steering are deactivated
Anti-skid provides a fixed aircraft deceleration.

variant.question: The alternate brake system uses:

options.text: The yellow hydraulic system.
The hydraulic accumulator.
The yellow hydraulic system and the hydraulic accumulator

variant.question: The antiskid system gets its reference speed from:

options.text: ADIRU 1 or 2 or 3.
ADIRU 2 or 3.
ADIRU 1 or 3.

variant.question: The principle of the anti-skid is

options.text: Comparing the speed difference between the four wheels.
Comparing wheel speed with A/C reference speed.
Comparing wheel speed with left and right landing gear.

variant.question: Following failure of ADIRS 1 and ADIRS 3, is the anti-skid still available?

options.text: Yes
No

variant.question: Green hydraulic system available, you find the A/SKID and NWS switch in OFF position:

options.text: Braking is normal, nosewheel steering lost.
Braking provided by yellow system, nosewheel steering normal.
Braking provided by yellow system, nose wheel steering lost.

variant.question: Alternate braking using the yellow system. Autobrake is:

options.text: Still available with anti-skid.
Lost.
Still available without anti-skid

variant.question: The purpose of the autobrake system is:

options.text: To reduce the braking distance in case of an aborted takeoff.
to increase the braking distance in case of an aborted takeoff.

variant.question: Setting the parking brake ON deactivates all braking modes, except the anti-skid.
Auto braking is initiated by

options.text: Reverse thrust selection.
Ground spoilers extension.
Reverse thrust selection after ground spoiler extension.

variant.question: The brake and accumulator pressure gauge shows pressure:

options.text: From yellow hydraulic system only
From accumulator only
From both yellow brake system and brake accumulator.

variant.question: On wheel page of ECAM, a green arc appears on one wheel indicator meaning the brake temperature is above:

options.text: 300°C.
100°C.
50°C.

variant.question: Landing gear can be extended by:

options.text: Green system or yellow in stand by.
Green system or mechanical gravity extension.
Green system for unlocking, gravity extension and green system for downlocking.
Blue system or mechanical gravity extension.

variant.question: Landing gear position is indicated by:

options.text: One panel on centre instrument panel and one panel on overhead panel.
ECAM only
One panel on centre instrument panel, ECAM
One panel on centre instrument panel, ECAM, visual means on the wing

variant.question: The take off has been rejected with max braking selected and engines in reverse. You have forgotten to arm the ground spoilers. Is autobrake activated?

options.text: Yes
No

variant.question: When auto brake operates, it can be disarmed by:

options.text: Pressing the push button or losing an arming condition
Depressing 1 pedal if MAX, MED or LO.
Ground spoilers retraction.
all of the given possibilities

variant.question:
The landing gear positions are indicated by 2 triangles for each gear. Each triangle is controlled by one LGCIU:

- a green triangle indicates that one LGCIU detects a landing gear downlocked.

- a red triangle indicates that one LGCIU detects a landing gear which is not locked in the selected position.
Automatic braking is initiated:

options.text: At the command for ground spoilers extension
At reverse selectio
At strut compression
At anti-skid activ

variant.question: 9 What is required to arm the auto brakes?

options.text: Green hydraulic pressure available, anti-skid electrical powered, no failure in the braking system, at least one ADIRS functioning
Green and Yellow hydraulic pressure available, anti-skid electrical powered, no failure in the braking system, all ADIRS functioning
Green hydraulic pressure available, anti-skid electrical powered, no failure in the braking system, all ADIRS functioning
Green hydraulic pressure available, no failure in the braking system, at least one ADIRS functioning

variant.question: When can the Warning Gear not downlocked be canceled using the MASTER WARNING light?

options.text: If the LG is not down and locked, radio height is lower than 750 ft and all engines NOT at takeoff power
If the LG is not down and locked, flaps at 2,3 or FULL, both Radio Altimeters failed and all engines NOT at takeoff power
It is not possible to cancel the aural warnings in approach conditions

variant.question: When does the HOT light on the BRK FAN Pb illuminate?

options.text: Brake temperature > 250 °C
Brake temperature > 300 °C
Brake temperature > 350 °C
Brake temperature > 350 °C

variant.question: Which answer about the landing gear indications is correct?

options.text: LGCIU 1 is connected to the Landing gear indicator panel only, if a fault is detected within LGCIU 1, the connection will be transferred to LGCIU 2
LGCIU 2 is connected to the Landing gear indicator panel only
LGCIU 1 is connected to the Landing gear indicator panel (as long it is electrically supplied) and supplies informations to the ECAM WHEEL Page
LGCIU 1 is connected to the Landing gear indicator panel (as long as no fault is detected) and supplies informations to the ECAM WHEEL Page

variant.question: 4 The max speed with landing gear extended (VLe) is:
The red arrow, near the landing gear lever, comes on when the landing gear is:

options.text: Not locked down when the aircraft is in Landing configuration, and a red warning appears on ECAM
Not locked down when the aircraft is in Approach (min. Flaps 2) configuration, below 1.000ft and a red warning appears on ECAM
Is in abnormal position
Not locked down when the aircraft is in Landing configuration or LGCIU 1 is faulty or landing gear is in an abnormal position

variant.question: One LGCIU controls one complete gear cycle, then switches over automatically to the other LGCIU.

options.text: It switches automatically at landing gear retraction
It switches automatically at landing gear extension
It switches automatically, when below 72 kt after touch down
It switches automatically after the second engine has been started

variant.question: The landing gear can be extended by:

options.text: The GREEN hydraulic system or gravity extension
The GREEN and YELLOW hydraulic system
The BLUE and GREEN hydraulic system
The GREEN and YELLOW hydraulic system and gravity extension

variant.question: Hydraulic pressure to the landing gear is supplied up to

options.text: 280 kts
any speed
260 kts
250 kts

variant.question: With the green hydraulic system available and the A/Skid and N/W steering switch in OFF position:

options.text: Braking is normal with antiskid and nose wheel steering is lost
Braking is alternate without antiskid and nose wheel steering is normal
Braking is alternate without antiskid and nose wheel steering lost
Braking is normal without antiskid and nose wheel steering is lost

variant.question: 0 Nose wheel steering is available when:

options.text: The A/SKID & N/W STRG switch is on and, the towing control lever is in normal position and, at least one engine is running, and the aircraft is on ground and, both BSCU channels are operative
The A/SKID & N/W STRG switch is on and, the towing control lever is in normal position and, at least one engine is running, and the aircraft is on ground
The A/SKID & N/W STRG switch is on and, the towing control lever is in normal position and, both engines are running, and the aircraft is on ground and, both BSCU channels must be operative
The A/SKID & N/W STRG switch is on and, the towing control lever is in normal position and, at least one engine is running, and at least GREEN hydraulic system is pressurized

variant.question: When the A/SKID & N/W STRG switch is set to OFF:

options.text: Antiskid is deactivated and nose wheel steering control by the pedals is disconnected
Antiskid is deactivated and nose wheel steering with the handwheel is lost (Pedal steering remains aviable)
Antiskid is deactivated, nose wheel steering is lost, and YELLOW hydraulic system supplies pressure to the brakes
Antiskid is deactivated, nose wheel steering is lost, and GREEN hydraulic system still supplies pressure to the brakes

variant.question: With the brake fan push button in ON position the brake fan runs:

options.text: When the aircraft is on ground
When the left main landing gear is downlocked
As long as the brake HOT light on the brake fan pushbutton is illuminated
When the right main landing gear is downlocked and the aircraft is on ground

variant.question: When a main gear shock absorber gets stuck in compressed position after lift-off:

options.text: The landing gear retraction is not affected
The landing gear can be retracted provided the nose gear steering is centered
The landing gear can not be retracted. The gear lever is locked in DOWN position
The landing gear will we retracted except of the gear associated with the failure, a L/G GEAR NOT UPLOCKED warning will be triggered

variant.question: If after a gravity gear extension the gear is downlocked but the gear lever is not set in DOWN position then...

options.text: it has no consequences neither for the indications nor for the operation of the gear
the ECAM alert L/G SYS DISAGREE will be triggered
the red UNLK lights on the gear indication panel remains on

variant.question: The brakes can be activated by independent systems, pressurized by the:

options.text: BLUE or GREEN hydraulic system
YELLOW or GREEN hydraulic system
BLUE or YELLOW hydraulic system
YELLOW or GREEN or ALTERNATE (BLUE) hydraulic system

variant.question: If a take-off is aborted just before V1 with auto brake selection MAX but spoilers not armed, the auto brake will:

options.text: Not be activated
Become active when at least one thrust lever is set to reverse, and the other at or near idle
Become active when both thrust levers are set to idle only
Become active when both thrust levers are set to reverse only

variant.question: On the ECAM wheel page, - AUTO BRK - is flashing green:

options.text: For ten seconds after auto brake disengagement
When auto brake is armed
For ten seconds after auto brake is engaged

variant.question: When does the control transfer between the two LGCIU’s happen?

options.text: After engine star
After a complete landing gear cycle (retraction phase) and in case of a failure
After a complete landing gear cycle (extension phase) and in case of a failure
After a complete landing gear cycle (After engine shutdown)

variant.question: What is indicated by a DECEL light being illuminated on the auto brake panel?

options.text: When the actual deceleration corresponds to the selected rate
When the actual deceleration is 50% or more of the selected rate
When the actual deceleration is 75% or more of the selected rate
When the actual deceleration is 80% or more of the selected rate

variant.question: If tire damage is suspected after landing or after a rejected takeoff, the following limitation must be adhered:

options.text: If one tire is deflated on one or more gears (i.e. a maximum of three tires), the speed should be limited to 7 knots when turning
If two tires are deflated on the same main gear (the other main gear tires not being deflated), speed should be limited to 3 knots and the nose wheel steering angle limited to 30 degrees
An inspection of the tires is required before taxi, and if the tires are deflated bit not damaged, the aircraft can be taxied at low speed
All answers are correct

variant.question: On the ECAM wheel page, AUTO BRK is flashing green:

options.text: When the auto brake is disengaged (flashing green for 10 seconds)
When the auto brake system is working properly and when the actual deceleration is 80% or more of the selected rate
When the BSCU detects a failure in the Antiskid system
When the actual decelaration is less than 80% of the selected rate

variant.question: The principle of the anti-skid is:

options.text: Comparing the speed difference between the four main wheels
Comparing wheel speed with A/C reference speed
Comparing wheel speed with left and right landing gear
Comparing speed difference between main wheels and nose wheels

variant.question: The handwheels in the cockpit provide a wheel steering angle of:

options.text: 85°
70°
75°

variant.question: The safety valve of the landing gear cuts off the hydraulic supply. At what airspeed?

options.text: < 220 kts
> 260kts

variant.question: The safety valve of the landing gear cuts off the hydraulic supply. At what speed?

options.text: < 220 kts
>260kts
>280 kts
230 kts

variant.question: You are ready to taxi. You apply the toe brakes on the rudder pedals and release the PARK BRK. The BRAKES pressure falls to zero. What should you do?

options.text: This should not happen and you must assume that the BRAKES pressure indicator has failed.
Nothing, as this is normal. The BRAKES pressure indicator only indicates alternate (yellow) brake pressure.
You must re-apply the PARK BRK and call for maintenance personnel as the main system pressure has failed.
The indication is normal because once the AUTO BRK is set to MAX the BRAKES indicator is by-passed.

variant.question: You perform a landing with AUTO/BRK set to MED. After touch down what triggers the AUTO/BRK?

options.text: The AUTO/BRK system works as soon as the main landing gear is compressed
AUTO/BRK commences when the ground spoilers extend and sends progressive pressure to the brakes after a few seconds
The AUTO/BRK system is triggered when the thrust reversers are unlocked
The AUTO/BRK system works as soon as the nose gear is compressed

variant.question: You have set the L/G selector to the DOWN position. While the landing gear is moving to the selected position, L/G CTL appears amber on the ECAM WHEEL PAGE, along with an ECAM caution. What causes this indication?

options.text: L/G is up and unlocked, the L/G doors are open and the L/G CTL shows lever positions disagree.
The computers which provide gear position information have failed.
The L/G is not locked in the selected position. L/G CTL lever and L/G position do not agree
L/G CTL indicates that the lowering system has failed. The gear must be extended by gravity.

variant.question: You have just set the parking brake handle to ON. Is it still possible to check the main brake system using the toe brakes?

options.text: Yes. As soon as you press the brake pedals the BRAKES indicator will read main system pressure.
No. It is not possible to press hard enough to obtain an accurate reading.
No. When the PARK BRK is set, the other braking modes are deactivated.

variant.question: During push back you start engine 2. After push back you observe the NW STRG DISC memo has changed to amber. Why?

options.text: The NW STRG disconnect mechanism has failed
The yellow hydraulic system is now pressurized and the amber caption is a warning not to move the hand wheel
The memo has become amber because one engine is running
The nose wheel steering is being re-connected by ground personnel. It is amber because the pin is removed
